property.name: hive.server2.thrift.port
property.description: TCP port number to listen on, default 10500.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.http.port
property.description: Port number of HiveServer2 Thrift interface when hive.server2.transport.mode is 'http'.

property.name: hive.server2.tez.sessions.per.default.queue
property.description: The maximum number of queries the Hive Interactive cluster will be able to handle concurrently.

property.name: hive.metastore.uris
property.description: Thrift URI for the remote metastore. Used by metastore client to connect to remote metastore.

property.name: hive.server2.enable.doAs
property.description: Setting this property to true will have HiveServer2 execute Hive operations as the user making the calls to it.
property.display-name: Run as end user instead of Hive user

property.name: hive.prewarm.enabled
property.description: Enables container prewarm for Tez (Hadoop 2 only)

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.reduce.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable vectorized mode of the reduce-side of query execution.

property.name: hive.server2.tez.default.queues
property.description: A list of comma separated values corresponding to YARN queues of the same name. When HiveServer2 is launched in Tez mode, this configuration needs to be set for multiple Tez sessions to run in parallel on the cluster.

property.name: hive.server2.tez.initialize.default.sessions
property.description: This flag is used in HiveServer2 to enable a user to use HiveServer2 without turning on Tez for HiveServer2. The user could potentially want to run queries over Tez without the pool of sessions.

property.name: hive.driver.parallel.compilation
property.description: This flag allows HiveServer2 to compile queries in parallel.

property.name: hive.server2.webui.port
property.description: Web UI port address

property.name: hive.server2.webui.use.ssl
property.description: Enable SSL for HiveServer2 Interactive

property.name: hive.server2.zookeeper.namespace
property.description: The parent node in ZooKeeper used by HiveServer2 when supporting dynamic service discovery.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.queue.name
property.description: Choose the YARN queue in this cluster that is dedicated to interactive query.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.yarn.shuffle.port
property.description: YARN shuffle port for LLAP-daemon-hosted shuffle.

property.name: hive.execution.mode
property.description: Chooses whether query fragments will run in container or in llap

property.name: hive.llap.io.enabled
property.description: Whether the LLAP IO layer is enabled.

property.name: hive.llap.io.use.lrfu
property.description: Whether ORC low-level cache should use LRFU cache policy instead of default (FIFO).

property.name: hive.llap.auto.allow.uber
property.description: Whether or not to allow the planner to run vertices in the AM.

property.name: hive.llap.object.cache.enabled
property.description: Cache objects (plans, hashtables, etc) in llap

property.name: hive.tez.input.generate.consistent.splits
property.description: Whether to generate consistent split locations when generating splits in the AM

property.name: hive.llap.client.consistent.splits
property.description: Whether to setup split locations to match nodes on which llap daemons are running, instead of using the locations provided by the split itself.

property.name: hive.exec.orc.split.strategy
property.description: This is not a user level config. BI strategy is used when the requirement is to spend less time in split generation as opposed to query execution (split generation does not read or cache file footers). ETL strategy is used when spending little more time in split generation is acceptable (split generation reads and caches file footers). HYBRID chooses between the above strategies based on heuristics.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.service.hosts
property.description: Explicitly specified hosts to use for LLAP scheduling. Useful for testing. By default, a ZooKeeper based registry is used.

property.name: hive.llap.io.memory.size
property.description: The amount of memory reserved for Hive's optimized in-memory cache.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.num.executors
property.display-name: Number of executors per LLAP Daemon
property.description: The number of fragments that a single LLAP daemon will run concurrently. Usually, this will be the same as the number of available CPUs

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.vcpus.per.instance
property.description: The total number of vcpus to use for the executors inside LLAP.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.yarn.container.mb
property.description: Total memory used by individual LLAP daemons (YARN Container size). This includes memory for the cache as well as for the query execution. Should be larger than the sum of the Daemon cache size and the daemon heap size, and should leave some headroom after this (In most cases: cache size + heap size + headroom = Memory Per Daemon).

property.name: hive.llap.io.threadpool.size
property.description: Specify the number of threads to use for low-level IO thread pool.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.rpc.port
property.description: The LLAP daemon RPC port.

property.name: hive.llap.management.rpc.port
property.description: RPC port for LLAP daemon management service.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.task.scheduler.enable.preemption
property.description: hive.llap.daemon.task.scheduler.enable.preemption

property.name: hive.tez.exec.print.summary
property.description: Display breakdown of execution steps, for every query executed by the shell.

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.mapjoin.native.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable native (i.e. non-pass through) vectorization of queries using MapJoin.

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.mapjoin.minmax.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable vector map join hash tables to use max / max filtering for integer join queries using MapJoin.

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.mapjoin.native.fast.hashtable.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable use of native fast vector map join hash tables in queries using MapJoin.

property.name: hive.optimize.dynamic.partition.hashjoin
property.description: Whether to enable dynamically partitioned hash join optimization. This setting is also dependent on enabling hive.auto.convert.join

property.name: hive.llap.zk.sm.connectionString
property.description: ZooKeeper connection string for ZooKeeper SecretManager.

property.name: hive.llap.io.memory.mode
property.description: LLAP IO memory usage; 'cache' (the default) uses data and metadata cache with a custom off-heap allocator, 'allocator' uses the custom allocator without the caches, 'none' doesn't use either (this mode may result in significant performance degradation)

property.name: hive.metastore.event.listeners
property.description: Listeners for metastore events

property.name: hive.auto.convert.join.noconditionaltask.size
property.description: If hive.auto.convert.join.noconditionaltask is off, this parameter does not take affect. However, if it is on, and the sum of size for n-1 of the tables/partitions for a n-way join is smaller than this size, the join is directly converted to a mapjoin(there is no conditional task). The default is 10MB.

property.name: hive.llap.task.scheduler.locality.delay
property.description: Amount of time to wait (in ms) before allocating a request which contains location information, to a location other than the ones requested. Set to -1 for an infinite delay, 0 for no delay.

property.name: hive.mapjoin.hybridgrace.hashtable
property.description: Whether to use hybrid grace hash join as the join method for mapjoin. Applies to dynamically partitioned joins when running in LLAP, but not to regular broadcast(map) joins. hive.llap.enable.grace.join.in.llap is used for this.

property.name: hive.llap.enable.grace.join.in.llap
property.description: Override if grace join should be allowed to run in llap for regular map joins. Dynamic partitioned joins will honor the hive.mapjoin.hybridgrace.hashtable property in LLAP

property.name: hive.llap.execution.mode
property.description: Chooses which fragments of a query will run in llap

property.name: hive.tez.cartesian-product.enabled
property.description: Use Tez cartesian product edge for Hive cartesian product

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.logger
property.description: Logger to be used by LLAP. (query-routing, RFA)

property.name: hive.server2.tez.sessions.custom.queue.allowed
property.description: Whether to allow the users of this HS2 to specify custom queues - yes, no (fail if specified), ignore (use the default queues even if a custom one is specified)

property.name: hive.server2.tez.sessions.restricted.configs
property.description: The list of configuration settings that the users of the session pool of this HS2 are not allowed to override

property.name: hive.tez.bucket.pruning
property.description: When pruning is enabled, filters on bucket columns will be processed by filtering the splits against a bitset of included buckets. This needs predicates produced by hive.optimize.ppd and hive.optimize.index.filters.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.am.liveness.heartbeat.interval.ms
property.description: Tez AM-LLAP heartbeat interval. This should be below the task timeout
